newsitem.title: EGYPT: Arafat and Egyptian president hold talks.
newsitem.headline: Arafat and Egyptian president hold talks.

text.p: Palestinian President Yasser Arafat held talks with President Hosni Mubarak on Monday as controversy raged in Israel over plans for a Jewish neighbourhood in Arab East Jerusalem.

There were no immediate details of their talks at the Ittihadia palace in Cairo. But Arafat, who arrived in the Egyptian capital earlier on Monday, regularly consults with Mubarak on his peace negotiations with Israel.

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed on Monday to strengthen Israel's hold over all of Jerusalem, saying he would decide within days whether to build a new Jewish neighbourhood in the Arab east of the city.
The Palestinians say that Arab East Jerusalem is the capital of their future state while Israel argues that the whole city is its undivided capital.
Israeli officials in Jerusalem had drafted plans to build apartment blocks in Har Homa but opposition members said building on the site would reignite Arab-Israeli violence.
Both Egypt and Arafat have slammed Netanyahu's settlement expansion pllicy, saying it is the biggest obstacle to peace.
